AdditionalFields.Value: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science,Tumor Biology

Description: Multiplexed, spatially resolved imaging assays allow to measure numerous proteins and mRNAs in intact tissue specimens. As such, they are powerful technologies for cancer research, with potential to illuminate cellular and acellular components that drive tumor initiation, growth, invasion and response to therapies. However, analytical challenges must be overcome to fully exploit these technologies to cancer research. In this session, we will present computational advancements in the analysis of high-dimensional spatial images, common analytical pitfalls and applications of multiplexed imaging to study cancer.
PrimaryCategory: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science
SearchResultBody: ED021. Multiplex, Spatially Resolved Imaging: Ready for Primetime?
Title: Multiplex, Spatially Resolved Imaging: Ready for Primetime?
